results.title: I want to be an engineer
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Margaret Pettigrew and Beverly Shaffer
results.brief_description: This film provides a lively introduction to the professional and personal lives of three female engineers - just a few of the growing number of women who are opting for “non-traditional” jobs. Their enthusiasm for and commitment to their work makes them convincing role models for high-school girls who might be considering engineering as a career possibility. As well, the film is effective in fostering positive attitudes towards women working in the traditionally male professions of science and technology.

results.title: I Walked with a zombie
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures, Val Lewton and Jacques Tourneur
results.brief_description: In this hauntingly loose transposition of Charlotte Bronte’s “Jane Eyre” to the West Indies, a nurse, summoned to look after a sick woman, falls in love with the brooding husband and encounters voodoo. An ambiguous combination of horror fantasy and psychological thriller, the film blurs the distinction between good and evil, poetically depicting tribal customs without condescension and stereotyping. Beautifully shot by cinematographer J. Roy Hunt, the shadowy night world pervades everything and everyone.’ I Walked with a Zombie’ stands as the zenith of director Jacques Tourneur and producer Val Lewton’s wonderful horror collaborations. Cast includes James Ellison, Frances Dee and Tom Conway.

results.title: I Vitelloni = The Young and the passionate = The Spivs
results.creator_credit: Cine Films, Peg Films, Luigi Ciacosi and Federico Fellini
results.brief_description: Fellini’s second feature is an autobiographical story of five young men who hang around a small sea-town playing pool, getting drunk and teasing young women. Though they all dream of living in the big city and making a success of their lives, only Moraldo manages to overcome inertia and moves to Rome. Anecdotal and often very funny, “I Vitelloni” finally conveys an aura of melancholy nostalgia as the desires and ambitions of the young men are revealed as ultimately unfulfillable: partly due to circumstance, partly due to economics, partly due to personal weakness.
results.title_for_label: I Vitelloni = The Young and the passionate = The Spivs

results.title: I told 'em exactly how to do it
results.creator_credit: Stephen Bosustow Productions, Hoffman-La Roche, Irvine H. Millgate, Stephen Bosustow and Sam Weiss
results.brief_description: Uses a series of dramatised incidents involving a plant foreman and his attempts to communicate his wishes to his workers in order to stimulate discussion about the communication problems between supervisors and workers.

results.title: I thought I knew but I was wrong: New Video Art from Australia
results.brief_description: I thought I knew but I was wrong: New Video Art From Australia is a proposed collaboration between ACMI and Asialink to tour an exhibition of contemporary Australian video art to selected venues throughout Asia in late 2004- early 2005. The exhibition will be curated by Alexie Glass, ACMI and Sarah Tutton, Asialink, and will include the work of a range of artists and filmmakers.

results.title: I Think they think: overcoming social phobia
results.creator_credit: Monkey See Productions, Christine Mason and Christopher Thomas
results.brief_description: Three sufferers of social phobia, a devastating anxiety disorder, share their experiences with the condition and the techniques they used to successfully overcome it. The techniques are based on cognitive behaviour therapy, which has proven to be successful in most treatment of social phobia. The program is intended for sufferers, family and friends, and health care workers. It covers defining social phobia, monitoring anxiety, cognitive behaviour therapy, managing anxiety through meditation, and medication.

results.title: I think they call him John
results.creator_credit: Samaritan, Jack Carruthers and John Krish
results.brief_description: John Cartner Ronson spends a typical Sunday alone with his memories in his home in a huge block of London flats. Old miner, old soldier, old gardener, and old age pensioner, he has been living on his own since his wife died nine years ago. An old man’s life has become the ultimate expression of that much discussed twentieth century condition, the failure of communication.

results.title: I think it's going to rain today
results.creator_credit: Center for Digital Storytelling US, ACMI and Joan Hobson
results.brief_description: The icy winter storm of abuse that a 14 year-old boy can bring upon a family. The unleashing of anger to deliberate acts of violence. Summer will come again but it will just take awhile.
